cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 405 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf of Mexico toward the central-southern Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor / Matagorda Bay area, Texas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas Gulf Coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island, including Galveston Bay and inland south-central Texas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (peak 35–45 kt/40–50 mph with higher gusts) possible late Friday into Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (1–3 ft) possible around Galveston Bay; significant surge (>3 ft) currently not forecast for Texas City
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals near 8 inches possible, creating flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning Friday; brief tornado/spin-up risk in outer rain bands Saturday
